name: Collaborative Research Internship
description: As the alternative capstone experience, this course provides students the opportunity to work in a cross-disciplinary collaborative environment to address case-based research questions.ÿStudents MUST apply for this course,ÿand topics will be made available at the time of application. Course Application & Procedures: https://www.utm.utoronto.ca/forensic/applications Notes:
prerequisites: Enrolment in a Forensic Science Specialist Program; completion of the statistics course(s) requirement listed within the student's Forensic Science Program (STA215H5, STA220H5, STA221H5; BIO360H5, BIO361H5; PSY201H5, PSY202H5); FSC300H5, FSC302H5 and permission of instructor. (Restricted to Forensic Science Specialists)
